• __all__
  • ScriptEmptyError
  • _quote_if_contains
  • Script
    • __init__
    • parse
    • __repr__
    • command
    • args
    • extend
    • cmdify
   1 # -*- coding=utf-8 -*-
   2 from __future__ import absolute_import, unicode_literals
   3 
   4 import itertools
   5 import re
   6 import shlex
   7 
   8 import six
   9 
  10 __all__ = ["ScriptEmptyError", "Script"]
  11 
  12 
  13 class ScriptEmptyError(ValueError):
  14     pass
  15 
  16 
  17 def _quote_if_contains(value, pattern):
  18     if next(re.finditer(pattern, value), None):
  19         return '"{0}"'.format(re.sub(r'(\\*)"', r'\1\1\\"', value))
  20     return value
  21 
  22 
  23 class Script(object):
  24     """Parse a script line (in Pipfile's [scripts] section).
  25 
  26     This always works in POSIX mode, even on Windows.
  27     """
  28 
  29     def __init__(self, command, args=None):
  30         self._parts = [command]
  31         if args:
  32             self._parts.extend(args)
  33 
  34     @classmethod
  35     def parse(cls, value):
  36         if isinstance(value, six.string_types):
  37             value = shlex.split(value)
  38         if not value:
  39             raise ScriptEmptyError(value)
  40         return cls(value[0], value[1:])
  41 
  42     def __repr__(self):
  43         return "Script({0!r})".format(self._parts)
  44 
  45     @property
  46     def command(self):
  47         return self._parts[0]
  48 
  49     @property
  50     def args(self):
  51         return self._parts[1:]
  52 
  53     def extend(self, extra_args):
  54         self._parts.extend(extra_args)
  55 
  56     def cmdify(self):
  57         """Encode into a cmd-executable string.
  58 
  59         This re-implements CreateProcess's quoting logic to turn a list of
  60         arguments into one single string for the shell to interpret.
  61 
  62         * All double quotes are escaped with a backslash.
  63         * Existing backslashes before a quote are doubled, so they are all
  64           escaped properly.
  65         * Backslashes elsewhere are left as-is; cmd will interpret them
  66           literally.
  67 
  68         The result is then quoted into a pair of double quotes to be grouped.
  69 
  70         An argument is intentionally not quoted if it does not contain
  71         whitespaces. This is done to be compatible with Windows built-in
  72         commands that don't work well with quotes, e.g. everything with `echo`,
  73         and DOS-style (forward slash) switches.
  74 
  75         The intended use of this function is to pre-process an argument list
  76         before passing it into ``subprocess.Popen(..., shell=True)``.
  77 
  78         See also: https://docs.python.org/3/library/subprocess.html#converting-argument-sequence
  79         """
  80         return " ".join(
  81             itertools.chain(
  82                 [_quote_if_contains(self.command, r"[\s^()]")],
  83                 (_quote_if_contains(arg, r"[\s^]") for arg in self.args),
  84             )
  85         )
